column2: Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$5$5$I take Wellbutrin XL 300 mg and have been taking it for 6+ years. Prior to it
column3: I tried every SSRI and newer drugs like Cymbalta. Wellbutrin is the only drug for depression that I could live with. ALL the others cause sexual problems
column6: fatique and still don't get rid of all the depression. One doctor added Zyprexa to the SSRIs I was taking and I put on 40 pounds! Getting off SSRIs are tough too. Electric shocks felt in my head and lights. Would never ever go back to them. Wellbutrin actually caused a boost in libido
column7: weight loss and high energy. If I had it to do over again
column8: Wellbutrin XL would be the starting med
column9: not the SSRI classes. Think about it this way: If you're depressed now
column10: how much more will you be when you lose interest in sex
column14: doctor's waiting room and have no energy to do anything? Those are the downsides of the SSRI class of meds. For me
column15: they made my life worse. I am rarely depressed now and take nothing else for it but an occasional Xanax if in a highly stressful situation at work. I lost all the weight I gained
column17: kayak and have a normal sex life. Please give Wellbutrin a try and if it doesn't work after a month or so

column1: 4$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/18/2014 1:01:14 AM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I have anxiety problems due to the combination of ADHD and Asperger's
column2: and Bupropion has seriously helped. I have taken this my entire life
column3: with the exception of my early years up to fifth grade. I recently went through a stint where I had tried to go off it once I had learned it was primarily an anti-depressant
column4: and I began having problematic panic attacks and would go through periods in which I could not stop crying. Since being back on this
column5: I must say I am satisfied with it. I have been off Concerta for a year
column6: and Bupropion has helped me to also keep my ADHD problems(impulsiveness
column7: hyperactivity) in check. I know this whole review probably doesn't matter too much
column8: but I wanted to give some insight for people with ADHD who are either starting or debating starting this medication. I see a lot of reviews from people who are taking this for depression
column9: so it'd be good to see something from someone with ADHD. There are much fewer and less present side effects than Clonidine
column10: so to me it's a good alternative.

25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I've had depression ever since 15
column3: and back then they gave me Celexa
column4: an SSRI. Didn't make much of a difference
column5: thought it was me. I went off that for a while and thought I just had to live with depression.

column1: Recently it started affecting me even more severely
column2: so I looked into other medications. Welbutrin (bupropion) sounded like it was worth a try
column4: not serotonin. I started it when I was 24
column5: and what a difference it has made! It's been about a year now
column6: and I can say that I actually feel normal. There is no long this yawning black hole over every day. There are still some days when I am sad
column7: but it's relatively easy to get over it. The only bad thing about this drug was during the first 2 weeks of taking it: I had really bad insomnia
column8: it was horrible. I had to take sleep aids every night. But that did eventually go away

column1: Some people have said this drug is awful and no one should take it because it makes them super anxious/nervous/irritable
column2: etc. Well that means it's probably the wrong drug for you. I would say
column5: and try different treatments until you find the one that works for you. This definitely worked for me
column6: it has been a God send. "

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$This review is for Aplenzin which is the only buproprion hydroBROMIDE to my knowledge. It's better than Wellbutrin which is Buproprion hydroCHLORIDE. Smoother
column4: fewer and less severe side effects. It's worth a try if buproprion seems to help but not just quite right for you.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$1$I switched over to Bupropion from Wellbutrin to save money.  What a mistake.  All I wanted to do was sleep.  I wasn't really depressed anymore but very tired.  To tired to go to work some days.  Pay the extra and get Wellbutrin.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $2$2$5$"I've been on this medication for about 2 years
column3: 300 mg daily.   There have been no unbearable side effects -- just a tendency toward constipation.

column2: I've used others that were more effective
column3: but had such bad side effects that I had to quit them. Overall
column4: I think this takes the basic depression from about a constant 8 down to a constant 3 or 4.    There have been many episodes of being quite depressed while on it.

column2: I'd rather take it than try other things.  I've used so many over the years
